intro: Pelargonium myrrhifolium var. myrrhifolium, commonly known as the myrrh-leaved geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its fragrant, dark green leaves that emit a strong, resinous scent. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a hardy, ornamental plant. Its unique fragrance and attractive foliage make it both a decorative and aromatic addition to gardens.
